@dansinker When I was that age I did that with dataviz and dropped out of school and I would advise it to anyone who knows how to learn well and is self-driven ‚Äì its been fun and paid the bills ever since

every time you visualize covid data you inherently endorse the quality of the source data, which we all know is wildly skewed and incomplete, I am not convinced this is better than not visualizing it at all
ask me about Mainstem

Most data visualization / pitches I have nowadays are more like "there isn't actually enough data here, and here's a few guesses why" and that is not nearly as appealing as a complicated colorful visualization, and just as important ‚Äì how do we properly visualize absence?

I keep revisiting the Library of Missing Datasets ( https://t.co/vw1OqMBL6l ) in my mind, I have spent so much time visualizing data that it has been hard to ignore the things that I cannot analyze or talk about because the raw material isn't there

It's extraordinarily difficult to track incredibly important pieces of information ‚Äì police shootings, FEC filings, firearms sales ‚Äì but incredibly easy to get the angle and speed of a particular pitch in a particular baseball game a few years ago

I keep thinking of data viz I want to do and I keep circling back to the fact that the things I am most interested in aren't counted, either because of ineptitude or bias or laziness https://t.co/l9WZ3mH0tw
can like 1 smart person try to fix this or what https://t.co/IYAYsm9vgQ
